Wisdom: إِنَّمَا الْمَرْءُ فِي الدُّنْيَا غَرَضٌ تَنْتَضِلُهُ الْمَنَايَا وَنَهَبٌ تُبَادِرُهُ الْمَصَائِبُ وَالْحَوَادِثُ
enWisdom: Indeed man (in this world) is only a target that is struck by [the arrows of] death and a booty that is rushed towards by tribulations and calamities
By the befalling of calamities blessings become roiled

Wisdom: كُرُورُ اللَّيْلِ وَالنَّهَارِ مَكْمَنُ الْآفَاتِ وَدَاعِي الشَّتَاتِ
enWisdom: The succession of the night and day is the hiding place of calamities and the herald of separation [from loved ones]
There is no escape for bodies from maladies

Wisdom: لَا يَأْمَنُ أَحَدٌ صُرُوفَ الزَّمَانِ وَلَا يَسْلَمُ مِنْ نَوَائِبِ الْأَيَّامِ
enWisdom: One is neither safe from the passage of time nor secure from the calamities of the days

Wisdom: يَنْبَغِي لِمَنْ عَرَفَ الزَّمَانَ أَنْ لَا يَأْمَنَ الصُّرُوفَ وَالْغِيَرَ
enWisdom: It behoves the one who knows about time not to feel secure from its adversities and vicissitudes
For every living thing there is an ailment
